title: Brake Problems
description: Diagnose brake issues on the Kymco AK 550i with dual front discs, single rear disc, and ABS.

nodes.text: What brake issue on your AK 550i?

nodes.warning: Brake fluid damages paint and plastics.
nodes.instructions: The AK 550i has dual front disc brakes — strong brakes are critical at the speeds this maxi-scooter can reach. Check front master cylinder reservoir on the right handlebar. DOT 4 fluid. Level should be between MIN and MAX marks. Dark/black fluid = contaminated, needs flush.
Check rear brake reservoir (left handlebar or foot area). The AK 550i has a rear disc brake. Check fluid level and pad wear.

The AK 550i has DUAL front calipers — check pads on BOTH sides. Look through the caliper inspection window or remove caliper. Replace at 1-1.5mm remaining. The AK 550i's speed capability makes quality pads essential. Also check both front discs for scoring or wear lip.
Check rear caliper pads. Replace at 1-1.5mm. Check rear disc for scoring.

The AK 550i has two front calipers. Check BOTH for: (1) Slide pin movement — should be smooth, (2) Piston retraction — piston should push back, (3) Fluid leaks at banjo bolts or seals. A stuck caliper on one side causes uneven braking.

Center stand, spin both wheels. The AK 550i has disc brakes front and rear — slight pad contact is normal on discs. Excessive drag = heat, pad wear, and fuel waste. Check if one front caliper is dragging more than the other.

nodes.warning: ABS is a critical safety system. Professional diagnosis recommended.
nodes.instructions: The AK 550i has ABS on both wheels. If ABS light stays on after startup: (1) Check wheel speed sensors — front and rear (dirt is the most common cause), (2) Clean ABS reluctor rings on both wheels, (3) Check sensor wiring for damage, (4) Check for fault codes via diagnostic port. ABS light staying on = ABS disabled, brakes still work normally but without anti-lock protection.

The AK 550i has three brake discs (two front, one rear). Check each for: (1) Minimum thickness (stamped on disc), (2) Warping — spin wheel and watch pad gap, (3) Scoring or grooves. A warped disc causes lever pulsation during braking.

nodes.warning: Pump lever before riding. Bed in new pads.
nodes.details: Replace pads on BOTH front calipers even if only one side is worn. Use quality pads rated for the AK 550i's speed. Pump lever several times after installation to seat pads.
Same procedure as front. Check disc for scoring.

nodes.action: Flush and replace all brake fluid.
nodes.details: Flush every 2 years. The AK 550i has ABS — follow the specific ABS bleed procedure (may require cycling the ABS pump). Front system has two calipers to bleed.

nodes.action: Clean discs and pads with brake cleaner.
nodes.details: Lightly sand glazed pads. Apply anti-squeal compound to pad backs. Do not contaminate friction surfaces.

nodes.warning: Use only silicone grease on slides.
nodes.action: Clean and lubricate caliper slide pins.
nodes.details: Remove slides, clean, apply silicone brake grease. This is the most common cause of uneven front braking on dual-disc setups.

nodes.action: Clean and lubricate rear caliper slides.

nodes.warning: Do not ride with a stuck piston.
nodes.details: Seal kits are available. If piston is heavily corroded, replace the entire caliper.

nodes.warning: Brake failure risk. Do not ride.
nodes.action: Find and fix the leak immediately.
nodes.details: Check banjo bolts (copper washers), brake lines, caliper seals. Replace any damaged component. Re-bleed after repair.
Two front calipers — bleed the caliper farthest from the master cylinder first. ABS models may need a specific bleeding sequence.
Standard bleed procedure. ABS models may require additional steps.

nodes.action: Clean ABS sensor and reluctor ring.
nodes.details: Remove sensor, wipe with a clean cloth. Clean metallic debris from reluctor ring. Reinstall and check if ABS light clears after riding.

nodes.action: Repair or replace damaged sensor wire.
nodes.details: Check connector for corrosion. Route wire away from heat sources and moving parts.
ABS module faults require proprietary diagnostic tools. Brakes still function without ABS, but anti-lock protection is disabled.

nodes.action: Replace the warped or worn disc.
nodes.details: If a front disc is warped, consider replacing both fronts for even braking. New pads recommended with new discs. Bed in properly.
